channel.title: How to get your compiler to work (including setting up ANT) (WINDOWS VISTA/7)
channel.description:
Well, im sure this has been posted a few times. But looks like people still dont know how to do this soooo, here I go.
SO!, your here because you keep gitting this dam error...
[IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/63skrd.jpg[/img]
Well!!, Follow these simple steps and you will be good to go :D
STEP 1) Download apache-ant
Goto: http://ant.apache.org/bindownload.cgi
Scroll down and download this file
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/123uuf7.jpg[/img]
Now, Extract the file to your C: using "Winzip", "Winrar", "7-zip" or any other archiving tool. (Google the name)
STEP 2) Set your environmental variables
So now that you have downloaded and extracted ant to your c:. Its time to set your environmental variables.
Right Click "My computer" and hit properties.
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/6dxzxw.jpg[/img]
Note:- If your using winXP or any other operating system besides Vista, skip the next line.
Now click on "Advanced System Settings" on the left
[IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/ke92qh.jpg[/img]
It shoudl pop up with a screen that looks like this.
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/5oyvqq.jpg[/img]
Goto the advenced tab if your not already there and click "Environmental Variables"
Now, it should pop up with another window that looks something like this:
[IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/6pasy8.jpg[/img]
Now click this "New" button below the top box
Now make a new one with the name "PATH" and value of where your apaches bin folder is located (For example, mine is C:\apache-ant-1.7.0\bin)
Put yours to where ever to extracted your apache to.
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/33tifrq.jpg[/img]
Now Just Ok out and Ok out again and whaalaa!!
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Tut part 2 reguaring this error
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/155qavt.jpg[/img]
Step 1) Download Jdk Java
Goto: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp and scroll down till you see "Java SE Development Kit (JDK)" and hit download
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/2uh058w.jpg[/img]
Next, you will come to a screen that looks like this
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/xm8rc0.jpg[/img]
Hit the accept button if not already selected.
Next, select the platform (Operating System you are using) and hit the continue button.
If your not sure what plat form your using right click "My computer" in xp or "Computer" in vista and hit properties. It will show you all the information
After hitting continue, you will get to a screen that looks like this
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/2ceqmmf.jpg[/img]
Check the checkmark beside "Java SE Development Kit 6u13".
Then click "Java SE Development Kit 6u13" below the checkmark and the download will pop up. Hit save, save it to a location you want and when the download is complete...run the file.
Step 2) Set your Environmental Variables
Right Click "My computer" and hit properties.
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/6dxzxw.jpg[/img]
Note:- If your using winXP or any other operating system besides Vista, skip the next line.
Now click on "Advanced System Settings" on the left
[IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/ke92qh.jpg[/img]
It shoudl pop up with a screen that looks like this.
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/5oyvqq.jpg[/img]
Goto the advenced tab if your not already there and click "Environmental Variables"
Now, it should pop up with another window that looks something like this:
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/311uvj9.jpg[/img]
Now click this "New" button below the bottom box
Now make a new one with the name "PATH" and value of where your jre bin folder in your JDK folder is located (For example, mine is C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\jre\bin)
Put yours to where ever you chose to install java (default is C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\jre\bin)
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/250sa3t.jpg[/img]
Now Just Ok out and Ok out again and whaalaa!!

item.title: How to get your compiler to work (including setting up ANT) (WINDOWS VISTA/7)
item.dc:creator: @Schaffer Schaffer
item.description:
@Schaffer wrote:

‘ant’ is not recognized as an internal or exteral command, operable program or batch file
Press any key

item.dc:creator: @Motenchu Motenchu
item.description:
@Motenchu wrote:

I got the Taskkill issue like Lemony but my ant and Java are working, when I configure server I get the taskkill error at the top then the rest still runs, when I run the server it says successful time 2 seconds but the actual server program never launches. without the server the fact that the client works is useless, can anyone help me get the server to run on my desktop?

Read full topic

item.title: How to get your compiler to work (including setting up ANT) (WINDOWS VISTA/7)
item.dc:creator: @Army123 Army123
item.description:
@Army123 wrote:

ok but here’s my problem… yes i know i just copy and pasted this… but i really need help… so dont flame on me.

[b]NOTE- I HAVE JDK VERSION 7, I DOWNLOADED THE "WINDOWS X86 VERSION BUT I CHECK ON MY COMPUTER PROPERTIES AND IT SAID 64-BIT OPERATING SYSTEM. SO SHOULD I UNINSTALL THE X86 VERSION AND DOWNLOAD THE WINDOWS X64 VERSION?
(http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk-7u1-download-513651.html)

  • ALSO INSTEAD OF USING WINRAR I USED WINZIP. - MY COMPUTER MANUFACTER IS TOSHIBA
    -WINDOWS EDITION : WINDOWS VISTA HOME PREMIUM[/b]

1.) ok i looked on google and found a good guide (i belive) http://forum.ragezone.com/f365/make-rsps-603179/ (not to be advatising)
ok once you looked on the site and see what i see. you will understand better. i did exactly what it said on the site except for portforwarding and doing the no-ip thingy. but i download the source testscape and i copy and paste the information provided on the site exactly on the testscape compile and runeserver. i clicked on edit and paste exactly what was on the site.
but when i did all that my source wouldnt work…
when i double click on compile this is what i get
“Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Starting TestScape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594”

this is what i edited inside of compile
“@echo off
title ArmyNation
color 3b
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_01\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_01\bin\java.exe” server
pause”

2.) also i download client source “testscape” that was on the site also and when i double click on source this is what i get
“Starting TestScape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594”

this is what i edited inside on “runserver”
“@echo off
title ArmyNation
color 3b
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_01\bin\java.exe” server
pause”

(EXCEPT NOW I EDITED SOME OF THE INFORMATION INSIDE THE SOURCE/CLIENT FILE. SO IT NOT EXACTLY THE SAME AS ON THE SITE)

PLEASE HELP!!

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“vamp256, post:23, topic:236756”][quote author=Dedeshede link=topic=312509.msg2772599#msg2772599 date=1241309508]
Says java.exe is not a command blah blah…I’ve set my path and everything…ant works. Just Java, even though I’ve set my path…help?
[/quote]
Same, And I did this AFTER it was updated…I’ve set my ant but says java.exe aint a command…i tried changing meh java path…i think i putit in wrong spot…is it the top or bottom box for the java one?[/quote]

It is the bottom one for java and the top one for ant.
